vaf

Class Trie

  • java.lang.Object
    • vaf.anagrammakers.Trie

  • public class Trie
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for keeping track of a set of words. In this case, it keeps track of the words in a dictionary file. Stores words in lower-case, only uses alphabetic characters (a-z). Created by Chloe on 10/7/16.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Trie.TrieNode
      Represents a node in a trie.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Trie()
      Constructs the root node.
      Trie(java.lang.String filePath)
      Constructs the root node and populates the trie with words from the given file if possible.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToTrie(java.lang.String word)
      Adds the given word to the trie if possible (doesn't accept words containing characters other than A-Z, a-z)
      void addWordList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> words)
      Adds all the words in a list to the trie
      java.lang.Boolean contains(java.lang.String word)
      Checks if the trie contains the given word.
      Trie.TrieNode getRoot()
      Returns the trie's root
      Trie.TrieNode hasChildWithLetter(java.lang.Character letter, Trie.TrieNode node)
      Given a letter and a trie node, returns the node that corresponds to the child of the given node with the given letter if it is in the trie, and null otherwise.
      java.lang.Boolean isPrefix(java.lang.String str)
      Checks if the given string is the prefix of a word in the trie.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public Trie(java.lang.String filePath)
        Constructs the root node and populates the trie with words from the given file if possible.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to a file containing the words to be added it is expected that there will be one words per line

    • Method Detail

        public void addToTrie(java.lang.String word)
        Adds the given word to the trie if possible (doesn't accept words containing characters other than A-Z, a-z)
        Parameters:
        word - the word to be added to the trie.

      • contains

        public java.lang.Boolean contains(java.lang.String word)
        Checks if the trie contains the given word.
        Parameters:
        word - the word we're looking for
        Returns:
        true if the trie contains the word, false otherwise

      • isPrefix

        public java.lang.Boolean isPrefix(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if the given string is the prefix of a word in the trie.
        Parameters:
        str - the string we're interested in
        Returns:
        true if the string is the prefix of a word in the trie, false otherwise.

      • addWordList

        public void addWordList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> words)
        Adds all the words in a list to the trie

      • hasChildWithLetter

        public Trie.TrieNode hasChildWithLetter(java.lang.Character letter,
                                        Trie.TrieNode node)
        Given a letter and a trie node, returns the node that corresponds to the child of the given node with the given letter if it is in the trie, and null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        letter - the letter corresponding to the child we're looking for
        node - the parent corresponding to the child we're looking for
        Returns:
        the child if it's in the trie, null otherwise.

        public Trie.TrieNode getRoot()
        Returns the trie's root
        Returns:
        the root of the trie
